snippet: Three pallets of floor tile, ordered by a man using someone else’s credit card, were delivered in front of a Brooklyn building and haven’t been seen since.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column describes scheme in which someone using a stolen credit card and supporting identification arranged for the purchase of more than four tons of imported Italian floor tiles to be delivered to a Brooklyn address; both the tile and the mysterious buyer, who did not live at the delivery address but signed for the shipment, have long since disappeared.
lead_paragraph: Three pallets of floor tile, ordered by a man using someone else’s credit card, were delivered in front of a Brooklyn building and haven’t been seen since.

headline.seo: An Unwitting Buyer, and 8,500 Pounds of Italian Tile That Vanished
headline.main: An Unwitting Buyer, and 8,500 Pounds of Italian Tile That Vanished
headline.print_headline: An Unwitting Buyer, and 8,500 Pounds of Italian Tile That Vanished
